intro: Molongum lucidum, commonly known as the glossy apple or glossy buckthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of eastern and southern Africa, where it typically grows in moist, wooded areas. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glossy, dark green leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature, attracting various birds and small mammals. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
